message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a novel approach for performing convolution of signals on curved surfaces and shows its utility in a variety of geometric deep learning applications. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) and graphics (cs.GR) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper introduces a new type of convolution that allows for the propagation and relation of directional information across layers, which suggests that it may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-categories.
